page.name: Suggestions for Further Learning & Course Reference List
page.content:
Other Courses in the LINCS ACP Series

  • ACP: Building Strategic Partnerships: Engaging Employees
  • ACP: Instructional Considerations for Adult Career Pathways 

Additional Resources

  • Bridging the Path Between Adult Education and Careers—a one-hour webinar by Women Employed: https://youtu.be/K_xcaI9-3nQ

  • Tricks of the Trade: Advice From a Higher Education Basic Needs Navigator (May 1, 2018)—Navigator Miguel Sanchez provides insights into his role and the work that he does to support student success.

References

Below is a list of references used in this course.

Alamprese, J. A., & Cheng, I.-F. (2020). Compendium of innovative practices: Adult education bridge programs and integrated education and training (IET) programs. Manhattan Strategy Group; Abt Associates.

Center for Law and Social Policy. (2016, February). Funding career pathways and career pathway bridges: A federal policy toolkit for states.
https://www.clasp.org/publications/report/brief/funding-career-pathways-and-career-pathway-bridges-federal-policy

Cosgrove, J., Cosgrove, M., & Giani, M. (2019). Exploring the impact of intrusive student support practices on non-degree, short-term credential completion. In Impacts of key community college strategies on non-degree credential completion by adult learners. Lumina Foundation; DVP-PRAXIS Ltd. https://www.luminafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/impacts-of-key-community-college-strategies-on-non-degree-credential-completion-by-adult-learners.pdf

Cotner, H., Bragg, D., Cheng, I., Costelloe, S., Freeman, B., Goold, G., Heiser, E., Lemire, S., Miller, D.G., Porowski, A., Van Noy, M., & Yadav, E. (2021). Designing and delivering career pathways at community colleges: A practice guide for educators (WWC 2021007). National Center for Education Evaluation and Regional Assistance (NCEE), Institute of Education Sciences, U.S. Department of Education. https://ies.ed.gov/ncee/wwc/Docs/PracticeGuide/WWC-PraxGuide-Career-Pathways-full-text-Final-508.pdf

Durham, C., Eyster, L., Cohen, E., Mikelson, K., & Cohen, E. (2017). Early results of the TAACCCT Grants (Trade Adjustment Assistance Community College and Career Training Grant Program Brief 4). Urban Institute. https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OASP/legacy/files/20170308-TAACCCT-Brief-4.pdf

Eyster, L., Anderson, T., Lerman, R. I., Kuehn, D., Barnow, B. S., Conway, M., Jain, R., & Montes, M. (2018). Findings from the Accelerating Opportunity evaluation. Urban Institute. https://www.urban.org/research/publication/findings-accelerating-opportunity-evaluation 

Hanover Research. (2018). Best practices for marketing to adult and non-traditional students. https://caladulted.org/DownloadFile/628

Jenkins, D., Brown, A. E., Fay, M. P., & Lahr, H. (2020). Funding guided pathways: A guide for community college leaders. Community College Research Center.

Koproske, C., Barnes, D., Delamater, A., Silverman, A., & Teske, S.  (2018). Integrating academic and career development. EAB. https://pages.eab.com/rs/732-GKV-655/images/AAF-IntegratingAcademicCareerDev-PDF.pdf

Love, I. (2019).  Navigating the journey: Encouraging student progress through enhanced support services in TAACCCT. New America. https://d1y8sb8igg2f8e.cloudfront.net/documents/Navigating_the_Journey_Document-v2_98Tr0C3.pdf

Missouri CTE Marketing Taskforce. (2018). Changing perceptions: Findings and recommendations from the Missouri Career and Technical Education Advisory Council’s Marketing Taskforce. https://s3.amazonaws.com/PCRN/uploads/TAtoStates2017-18_MO_FinalReport.pdf

Nagoita, M. (2019). The effect of intrusive advising on nondegree program completion. https://www.luminafoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/impacts-of-key-community-college-strategies-on-non-degree-credential-completion-by-adult-learners.pdf

Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education. (2016). Career pathways systems. U.S. Department of Education.

Office of Vocational and Adult Education. (2012). Promoting college and career readiness: Bridge programs for low-skill adults. U.S. Department of Education. https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ovae/pi/cclo/brief-1-bridge-programs.pdf

RP Group. (2015). CTE bridge programs: Advancing the success of students with educational and employment barriers. https://rpgroup.org/Portals/0/Documents/Archive/BAWFC-Bridge-Program-Evaluation-Brief-July2015.pdf

Smith, K. G., Lee, L., Osborne-Lampkin, L., & Rall, J. (2020). Self-study guide for evidence-based practices in adult literacy education (REL 2020–025). U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences, National Center for Education Evaluation and Regional Assistance, Regional Educational Laboratory Southeast. https://ies.ed.gov/ncee/edlabs/regions/southeast/pdf/REL_2020025.pdf

Washington Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction. (2020, February). Unlocking federal and state program funds to support student success. https://www.k12.wa.us/sites/default/files/public/esea/pubdocs/Unlocking_State_Federal_Program_Funds.pdf

Women Employed, Chicago Jobs Council, & UIC Great Cities Institute. (2005). Bridges to careers for low-skilled adults: A program development guide. Women Employed. https://womenemployed.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/BridgeGuide.FullReport.2005.pdf
